CWEs: CWE-79: Improper Neutralization of Input During Web Page Generation ('Cross-site Scripting')
description: The function does not properly sanitize the 'selector' input, which can lead to Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) attacks. An attacker can inject malicious scripts through the 'selector' parameter, which will then be executed in the user's browser. This can lead to various harmful actions such as stealing sensitive information, performing actions on behalf of the user, or delivering malware.
